articles.title: Australian Open matches could be suspended over bushfire smoke: organisers
articles.description: Australian Open organisers are monitoring the deteriorating air quality in Melbourne and said matches could be suspended if conditions become hazardous amid the bushfire crisis.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE, Australia (Reuters) - Australian Open organisers are monitoring the deteriorating air quality in Melbourne and said matches could be suspended if conditions become hazardous amid the bushfire crisis.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Highway crash in Peru kills 16, including two Germans
articles.description: At least 16 people, including two Germans, died in a crash in southern Peru on Monday after a bus collided with other vehicles and rolled over, local police said.
articles.content:
LIMA (Reuters) - At least 16 people, including two Germans, died in a crash in southern Peru on Monday after a bus collided with other vehicles and rolled over, local police said. 
The accident also left 42 others injured, including two Brazilians and two Am… [+1112 chars]

articles.title: Four-day refinery strike in France should not leave motorists stranded - Total
articles.description: French oil major Total said on Monday that strikes against the government's pension reform were having no impact on its fuel supply and distribution ahead of a four-day nationwide strike in French oil refineries.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - French oil major Total (TOTF.PA) said on Monday that strikes against the government’s pension reform were having no impact on its fuel supply and distribution ahead of a four-day nationwide strike in French oil refineries.

articles.author: Robenson Sanon
articles.title: Ten years after Haiti quake, a man left disabled struggles to rebuild his life
articles.description: Haiti's calamitous earthquake a decade ago leveled much of the capital, killed tens of thousands and left some 1.5 million people homeless.
articles.content:
PORT-AU-PRINCE (Reuters) - Haiti’s calamitous earthquake a decade ago leveled much of the capital, killed tens of thousands and left some 1.5 million people homeless. 
One of its longer term consequences has been the estimated 4,000 to 6,000 people who were … [+2298 chars]

articles.description: France's foreign minister said on Monday the substance of the Iran nuclear deal was slowly disappearing and European powers would decide in coming days whether to launch a dispute resolution process over Iran's latest violations.

articles.title: Too old? Too slow? No! Debut marathoners may add years to life
articles.description: First-time marathon runners can add years to their lives and reap the health rewards of lower blood pressure and healthier arteries, even if they take on the challenge in mid- to later life, research showed on Monday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. girl killed in highway attack near border in Mexico
articles.description: A 13-year-old American girl was killed over the weekend after the vehicle she and her family were traveling in came under fire on a highway south of the Mexican border city of Nuevo Laredo, state security officials said on Monday.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - A 13-year-old American girl was killed over the weekend after the vehicle she and her family were traveling in came under fire on a highway south of the Mexican border city of Nuevo Laredo, state security officials said on Monday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: For Democrats, little recourse over Trump on Iran
articles.description: U.S. lawmakers have few options for tamping down any escalation by President Donald Trump of tensions with Iran, despite Democrats’ outrage over his failure to inform Congress in advance about a strike against a top Iranian military commander.
articles.content:
Posted 
U.S. lawmakers have few options for tamping down any escalation by President Donald Trump of tensions with Iran, despite Democrats outrage over his failure to inform Congress in advance about a strike against a top Iranian military commander.
